physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Initial cardiovascular magnetic resonance (CMR) scan done 48 hours after PCI showed mid-wall late gadolinium enhancement compatible with the septal perforation and evidence of a chronic inferior wall subendocardial infarct.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: A follow-up CMR scan performed 8 weeks after the procedure showed a smaller area of focal fibrosis in the mid septum compared to the previous scan, indicating likely infarct resorption and reduced inflammatory changes.
